diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Bladder cancer, adenocarcinoma of the bladder, involvement by colonic adenocarcinoma, ductal adenocarcinoma of the prostate
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with gross, painless hematuria and a mass in the bladder. Imaging revealed a multilobulated mass, and pathological examination showed adenocarcinoma. Specific immunohistochemical staining confirmed prostatic origin and identified ductal adenocarcinoma, which was unusual in location.
